summary: The 'Returning SBA to Main Street Act' mandates the Small Business Administration (SBA) to relocate at least 30% of its headquarters employees outside the Washington metropolitan area within one year of enactment. The bill also requires reducing headquarters office space by at least 30%. It covers employee pay adjustments based on new duty stations, the exclusion of certain employees with disabilities, reporting requirements to Congress, and the inclusion of specific information in future budget justification materials. The bill aims to promote geographic diversity and in-person customer service.
